titleStmt.title: A. C. Lamhart et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG5389

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: We the citizens of Jackson county Kentucky respectfully petition and represent to the Govenor of the commonwealth that William Legston was fined twenty dollars and James Francis Marian Coyle was fined the like amount by John W. Harcourt a justice of the peace of Madison county for getting drunk and making a noise in the town of Richmond. No person was hurt and the said parties accidentally became intoxicated. We know them well and know they are peaceably orderly good citizens and are not in the habit of getting drunk. Legston has just returned from several years service in the federal army. We must respectfully ask the remission of the fine.

A C Lamhart
Joseph Collins
Jackson Blanton
Alexander Blanton
G W Murphy
Pery g Caxt
Lewis Cax
William Blanton
John g Sparks
Wm B Murphy
Eg Murphy
John Murphy
Thomas P heather
Edward lynch
N j Coyle
J P Logsdon
W. R Coyle
Godfrey Isaacs
Ambrosen Logsdon
J B Logsdon
O F Ashlle
S R Baker
John Dose
Harden Cax
Milton D Cax
pary Skinner
Simpson Cax
